abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Higher Education Project
            (HEP2) aims to increase the quality of teaching and research
            in universities in ways that improve the employability of
            graduates and the relevance of research in Vietnam. The
            project will achieve its objective through: (i) developing
            policy and building capacity at the central government level
            in the areas of governance, financing and quality assurance;
            and (ii) building capacity, relevance and autonomy at the
            university level. HEP2 comprises of three components, with
            the first being capacity building for policy development. It
            aims to develop policy and build capacity in policy
            development in the key areas of: (a) the organization of the
            higher education system and its governance at central and
            higher level institutions (HEI) levels; (b) the public
            supply- and demand-side finding of higher education; and (c)
            quality of students at entry and quality of services
            provided by HEIs. The second component is the capacity
            building for the university teaching and research. This
            component is designed to strengthen teaching and research in
            selected universities, by: (i) building management capacity
            in universities; and (ii) financing teaching and research
            innovation grant (TRIG) sub-projects in two groups of
            selected universities. The third component is the project
            management, monitoring and evaluation. It aims to support
            and ensure a smooth and effective implementation of the project.
